subsection_name: benh-tui-thua-dai-trang.json_3_Factors that increase the risk of diverticulitis
subsection_content:
Some factors can increase the risk of developing diverticulitis such as:
Older age; Sedentary; Low-fiber diet; Certain medications such as antihypertensives, diuretics, and narcotic pain relievers can increase constipation and increase pressure within the colon. Any factor that increases pressure can lead to the formation of multiple diverticula.
